intro: Vaccinium repens, commonly known as creeping bilberry, is a low-growing evergreen shrub belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that are rich in antioxidants and are often used in culinary and medicinal applications. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is commonly found in heathlands and open woodlands. Vaccinium repens plays an important ecological role by providing food for various wildlife species.
